meanings.definition: Strong desire for wealth or possessions.
meanings.sent1: Her cupidities drove her to work long hours to buy a new car.
meanings.sent2: His cupidities led him to collect rare coins as a hobby.
meanings.sent3: The man's cupidities for expensive watches made him the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The cupidities of the corporation knew no bounds when it came to profits.
meanings.sent5: The allure of gold sparked cupidities in the hearts of many.

meanings.sent1: The king's cupidities for land and power were well-known throughout the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The businessman's cupidities knew no limits as he sought more wealth.
meanings.sent3: The cat's cupidities for treats made it a master of manipulation.
meanings.sent4: The cupidities of the villain consumed him, leading to his downfall.
meanings.sent5: The cupidities of the greedy merchant were evident in his every action.

meanings.definition: Excessive desire for power or control.
meanings.sent1: The dictator's cupidities for control knew no bounds, leading to oppression.
meanings.sent2: The politician's cupidities for power clouded his judgment.
meanings.sent3: The cupidities of the toddler for the TV remote were comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The CEO's cupidities for dominance made him feared in the boardroom.
meanings.sent5: The general's cupidities for victory drove his troops to great feats.
